rooms.description: Large entrance area with reception desk and waiting area, incorporating Brutalist design elements like exposed concrete and raw finishes.
Spacious living area following Vastu principles with east-facing windows for positive energy. Designed with minimalist yet robust Brutalist aesthetics.
Integrated dining space near the kitchen for functional flow, featuring a concrete table and pendant lighting.
Modern, efficiently designed kitchen that adheres to local building norms with an emphasis on durability and ease of cleaning. Includes a prep area near the dining space.
Dedicated library area, with built-in shelves made from raw concrete and exposed brick, designed for quiet contemplation. North-facing to align with Vastu principles.
Two-car garage space integrated into the ground floor plan; designed for easy access and utility vehicle storage. Reinforced with robust concrete structures.
Compact living space for domestic help, positioned away from main living areas to maintain privacy and adhere to local cultural norms. Includes a small kitchenette.
Ground floor bathroom, strategically placed near the entrance hall for ease of access, designed with durability and minimal maintenance in mind.

openings.description: Large concrete entrance door with robust locking system; designed to reflect the raw aesthetic of Brutalism.
East-facing large windows for natural light in the living room, aligning with Vastu principles.
Functional window above the kitchen area for ventilation and access to natural light.
Small windows ensuring proper ventilation in the servants' quarters, maintaining privacy while providing light.

additional_info.design_principles: Brutalist design with emphasis on raw materials and honest structural expressions. Incorporates local building norms and Vastu principles to enhance energy flow and functionality.
